propertyInfos.label: Portal or ArcGIS Online URL
propertyInfos.hint: The app is designed to work with secured feature services and will ask the user to sign in to the portal specified by this url using OAuth2.
propertyInfos.name: Portal or ArcGIS Online URL

propertyInfos.label: Application clientId
propertyInfos.hint: You need to register your application at https://developers.arcgis.com which in turn will provide you with a clientID. Add the following rediect URI to the registered application item: urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob
propertyInfos.name: clientId

propertyInfos.label: App Title
propertyInfos.hint: The app title is displayed in th title bar.
propertyInfos.name: App Title

propertyInfos.label: App Description
propertyInfos.hint: The app description is shown on the start screen of the application.
propertyInfos.name: App Description

propertyInfos.label: Basemap Tile Package Item ID
propertyInfos.hint: The map uses a tile package as a basemap. The tile package is also used to determine which features from the feature service (see next parameter) are downloaded to the device: only features that intersect the extent of the tile package will be downloaded. The tile package needs to be uploaded to ArcGIS Online and be accessible without authentication (i.e. shared with everyone, not just an ArcGIS Online Group.) Enter the Tile Package's Item ID. Preferrably scale levels should be identical to the ones used by the three onine basemap map services specified below.
propertyInfos.name: Basemap Tile Package Item ID

propertyInfos.label: Floor Plans and Buildings Feature Service URL
propertyInfos.hint: This feature service needs to contain one polygon layer with building footprints and two layers (lines and polygons) with interior building floor plans. Access to it can be public or can be restricted via ArcGIS Online item sharing properties.
propertyInfos.name: Floor Plans and Buildings Feature Service URL

propertyInfos.label: Building Polygons LayerID
propertyInfos.hint: The Feature Service layer ID of the building polygons layer. For example, if the buildings layer is 'on top of' all other layers this parameter should be 0 .
propertyInfos.name: Building Polygons LayerID

propertyInfos.hint: The Feature Service layer ID of the floor plan lines layer.

propertyInfos.label: Points layer Feature Service URL
propertyInfos.hint: This feature service needs to contain one points layer (cordiante system: Web Mercator) with geodatabase attachments enabled, and one geodatabase table (a geodatabase relationship class can exist but is not necessary.) Access to it can be public or can be restricted via ArcGIS Online item sharing properties.
propertyInfos.name: featuresUrl2

propertyInfos.label: Points layer building ID field
propertyInfos.hint: This points layer attribute field stores the building id with which a point feature is associated. In combination with the parameter below it is used to display on the map only the points located on the currently visible floor. Further, when a new point is created this attribtue will automatically be set to the currently selected building id.
propertyInfos.name: pointsLyr_bldgIdField

propertyInfos.label: Points layer floor ID field
propertyInfos.hint: This points layer attribute field stores the floor id with which a point feature is associated. In combination with the parameter above it is used to display on the map only the points located on the currently visible floor. Further, when a new point is created this attribtue will automatically be set to the currently selected floor id.
propertyInfos.name: pointsLyr_floorIdField

propertyInfos.label: Points layer search field
propertyInfos.hint: The field that the points layer can be search on via the search menu
propertyInfos.name: pointsLyr_searchField

propertyInfos.label: Points layer fields to hide in attribute display
propertyInfos.hint: Points layer attribute fields to hide (comma seperated, without spaces). Example: OBJECTID,GlobalID . If you want to show all fields then just leave this parameter blank.
propertyInfos.name: pointsLyr_hideFields

propertyInfos.label: Points layer foreign key attribute field
propertyInfos.hint: The foreign key field in the geodatabase points feature class based on which the point feature can be associated with records form the geodatabase table.
propertyInfos.name: pointsLyr_fkField

propertyInfos.label: Related table fields to hide in attribute display
propertyInfos.hint: Related table attribute fields to hide (comma seperated, without spaces). Example: OBJECTID,GloabalID,Rel_GobalID . If you want to show all fields then just leave this parameter blank.
propertyInfos.name: relTable_hideFields

propertyInfos.label: Related table foreign key attribute field
propertyInfos.hint: The foreign key field in the geodatabase table based on which the table records can be associated with point features.
propertyInfos.name: relTable_fkField
